p: In the District Court of the Third Judicial District holding terms at Seattle, King County, Washington Territory.
To the Hon. Roger S. Greene, Judge of the above entitled Court,

Your petitioner would respectfully represent that Gee Lee a Chinaman and a great number of other Chinese persons, residents of the City of Seattle, being all such persons who are passengers on board stemship "Queen of the Pacific" any more particular description of whom, by number, name or otherwise, it is impossible for your petitioner to give, are now restrained of their liberty on board said steamship, lying at the Ocean Dock at the city of Seattle,

That said Chinaman and others are restrained of their liberty by Malcolm m Millan; James Poetuter and John Alexander and others to your petitioner unknown, on board said steamship. The cause of the restraint of said Chinaman and each of said Chinamen aforesaid
is as your petitioner is informed, an unlawful attempt to compel said Chinamen to leave the Territory of Washington against their will and consent and by ....idation the said restraint is illegal in this that by force, threats and intimidation the persons heretofore mentioned as restraining said Chinesemen and Gee Lee and under said restraint are forcing said Chinesment against their consent to leave the Territory of Washington.

That your petitioner makes this petition and application of behalf of said Gee Lee and seventy five other Chinamen, as their next friend and because they are prevented from making this application themselves by the facts of the persons herebefore mentioned as restraining them of their liberty.
Wherefore your petitioner prays for writ of Habeas Corpus for the relief herein prayed
